text: Michael McCartan (1 January 1851 – 30 September 1902) was an Irish nationalist politician. He sat in the House of Commons of the United Kingdom from 1886 to 1902. McCartan was born in Castlewellan, County Down, and educated at St. Malachy's College in Belfast and then Blackrock College. He became a solicitor in 1882. At the 1886 general election he was elected as the Member of Parliament (MP) for South Down. He sat for the Irish Parliamentary Party until the split in 1890, when he joined the anti-Parnellite Irish National Federation, he rejoined the IPP is 1900 when the two sides re-united in 1900. Having been re-elected 3 times, McCartan resigned from the House of Commons on 1 February 1902. He died in September that year aged 51. == References == == External links == * Category:1851 births Category:1902 deaths Category:Members of the Parliament of the United Kingdom for County Down constituencies (1801–1922) Category:Irish Parliamentary Party MPs Category:Anti-Parnellite MPs Category:UK MPs 1886–1892 Category:UK MPs 1892–1895 Category:UK MPs 1895–1900 Category:UK MPs 1900–1906 Category:People from County Down Category:People educated at St Malachy's College Category:People educated at Blackrock College
title: Michael McCartan
